Now, let's create the 2D sketch. The sketch is drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. In this case, the sketch will be drawn on the XY plane. The sketch (face\\_1) consists of one loop (loop\\_1), which in turn consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4). - line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.1577] - line\\_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.1577], End Point = [0.0, 0.1577] - line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.1577], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] The loop is always closed, and a loop can consist of multiple lines and/or arcs. In this case, the loop consists of four lines. Now, let's transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. We will use the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system to do this. Finally, let's extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrude depth towards the normal is 0.02, and the extrude depth opposite the normal is 0.0. The sketch scale is 0.75. The boolean operation for this part is to create a new solid body. The description of this part is as follows: - shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is twice the width, and the length is three times the width. The sides are parallel to each other. - length: 0.75 - width: 0.75 - height: 0.02 The length of this part is 0.75, the width is 0.75, and the height is 0.02. Please ensure that the measurements are accurate to ensure the final shape fits the specified dimensions.</description>
